creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
inscription: left margin: 昭和廿三年作 {Shōwa nijūsannen saku}
markings: LRC, red round artist's seal: 川セ {Kawase}
medium: Woodblock print, ink and color on paper
text: The To_sho_ Shrine (To_sho_gu_), in Tokyo’s Ueno Park, is dedicated to the first Tokugawa shogun, Ieyasu (1543–1616). It affords a good view of the five-storied pagoda of Kan’ei Temple, pictured here, where six of the fifteen shoguns are interred.
title: Spring Dusk at the Tōshō Shrine in Ueno
